Reviews.Title: “Elysee Hotel: great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid154943
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Elysee Hotel in March 2012, and were pleasantly surprised by the great value and superb location of this modest but modern facility. The staff were efficient and helpful, the rooms - basic, but clean and recently renovated. Room rates were entirely affordable, even for travelers on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, cold shower!”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my worst experiences. The location is great, but thats all! The room was so small that my suitcase couldn`t be opened on the floor. The shower had no hot water and the water pressure was inanely low. The staff wasn´t service minded. I will never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ina B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was small, but the staff were very nice & helpful, and it was clean. It was in a great location, close to 2 major subway stations and 2 minutes from Kensington Gardens. The breakfast was good with fresh food being made up to the end, and the price was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!”
Reviews.Author: The_Peppin-Hugheses
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid March and although the receptionist was nice the hotel was a little bit disappointing. Our first room was cramped and claustrophobic, the shower cubicle fell apart on first use and the phone didn't work. Our second room was nicer though and to the Hotel's credit was sorted immediately. Breakfast was good and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Trond K
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from Paddington station (end station from Heatrow airport), you'll find Elysee hotel. The area is quiet and boring, but it is not far to Oxford street, Regent street ++. Located 100 meteres from Hyde park, it is worth a try. The rooms are small, and not very clean, but ok. The breakfast was also ok, but nothing more. Price is also not very high, so in total I was satisfied. The tube are not far away, and takes you to downtown London in few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Holly H
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and my mother and I stayed her recently on a quick tour of London. The hotel was clean, warm and in a great location! The hotel staff could not have been more helpful. They helped us book our tours and our transportation back to the airport. They also accomodated every request we had. They were super friendly and helpful. Also, the hotel is in a great location for all sites. We bought the hop on, hop off tickets on the bus and had a terrific tour of all the important venues, including Buckingham Palace. There's also a terrific pub just across the street from the hotel, with great food and super friendly staff. I would go back and stay there again for sure! Oh and the free breakfast was super! Holly Henry Wisconsin, USA

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Shaun101
Reviews.Content: The good 1. Great location. Walking distance from Hyde Park, Oxford and Regeant Street. 2. A lot of restaurants around with various cuisines like Indian, Italian and the typical english pubs. 3. Very clean hotel. The bathrooms were clean which is the most important part. The bad - 1. Tiny Tiny rooms. Barely enough place to do anything by sleep. 2. Bathrooms are too small. If you bend in the shower cubicle, parts of your body will touch the cold sides of the shower cubicle. 3. Pretty expensive for such a hotel. I paid 125 Euro a night which in many other countries would get me a 5 star deluxe hotels, but I undertand London is a really expensive. 4. The breakfast was the same every day. Scrambeled eggs, boiled eggs, toast, bakes beans, coffee, cheese, butter, juices and cereals. It is the same every day. I wish there was some suasages and bacon. 5. Rooms facing the road, attract noises from the pub opposite. All in all, a fair experience. the location was just super. You can just walk from Paddington station to the hotel. It is about a 8 to 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “£92 for a morning wake up call”
Reviews.Author: Mwf_CIL
Reviews.Content: Not a bad small single room on first impression. I stay in many hotel rooms all over the world on holiday and for work, so I'm not fickle. No coffee in the welcome tray only tea, but I was tired on arrival so could not be bothered asking the Indian looking fella on reception. Bed was noisy and almost not comfy for my 6ft mass. But I slept. However at 6am I was woken by the bathroom extract fan, then hairdryer and toilet flush etc, from either side of my room. Being woke 1.5 hrs earlier than I planned defeated my plan of booking a hotel room within 1 mile of my London meeting. And I did tell the hotel in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: bella1180
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for two night. After reading some of the reviews i was rather concerend. I didnt need to be. It was clean and tidy a very good location for Hyde Park and the tube station just around the corner. We had air con in our room which was much needed as it was so hot the weekend that we came to London and were very pleased about this We found the staff very helpful especially when we came home at 2 in the morning and wanted food. The only real problem we found with this hotel was the bathroom being very small but as we were only in the room a short time to get ready is wasnt a massive problem. Also we managed to set the fire alarm off 3 times, they appear to be very sensitive so stay well away from it when you are spraying deoderant or anything for that matter. When i go to London in January i will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Marja K
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for three people. The room turned out to be a tiny dark place with a small window in the end of a narrow corridor overlooking a bin and the wall of the opposite house. We complained to the reception immediately and cancelled further bookings after one night. The person in the reception said we should speak to the manager who was not available and wouldn't be available the next day either. They didn't offer any better rooms or money back. According to the receptionist this was nothing to do with the hotel but the agency who made the booking via internet. Nobody takes responsibility! This hotel was not worth four or three stars as advertised misleadingly but an expensive trap which ruined a part of our trip. We couldn't stay there more than one night but they took our money for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there”
Reviews.Author: barbara y
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night stay as attending "Proms in the park" So disappointed. Our allocated room was in the basement. You couldnt see daylight as there was a wall directly outside the window.The room was shabby. There was a musty smell and damp patches on the wall. The width of the room was just slightly bigger than the lenght of a double bed. We didnt even look in the bathroom. On requesting a different room we were told no chance, That we should have specified which floor we wanted on the "special requests" when making the booking. The manager was unavailable and we were told if we had a complaint we should direct it to "Booking.com" with whom we booked 3 months ago and we could check out if we wanted. We did. We spent over 1 hour going from hotel to hotel trying to find a room, in London, on a Saturday afternoon. We were very lucky to find a room at the Radisson near Marble Arch.What a difference. The pictures on the Elysee website must have been taken at a different hotel.This was the worst room we have ever been allocated!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiggaMan
Reviews.Content: This was a little higher scale place then we would usually book but after a long day of traveling we didn't want to play any games and have a nice place to rest up at. The location is good, walking distance from Paddington Station and right around the corner from Hyde Park. They also offer breakfast in the morning with cereals, eggs, beans, and fruits so that is a plus. The staff were on top of there game and no problems with them. They did lock the door late at night when we arrived after late night drinking but a man was there to open up right away so it's secure. The room was clean if not a bit small. They did allow us to store our luggage there after we checked out, a positive. Overall it's a quality spot.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: choppen
Reviews.Content: upon walking in the place is not really like the pictures shown on website. The staff were friendly our room was adouble but very small good job only there for 3nights had to leave our things in suitcase as not enough hanging space.The shower door was hanging off but to their credit they sorted it out in about 10mins. the beakfast was basic but there was plenty.The biggest disappointment was the bar we only used on 1 occasion nobody else in, my husband ordered lager me a vodka and coke, he said only coke was in the vending machine which was out of order, he only had orange fruit juice which i agreed on but then we found both the lager and juice to be out of date the juice by over a year, omg when did they last do a stock check. Overall the place was clean and bed was comfy, would i stay again, probably if only because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Central London - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: finny311
Reviews.Content: I gave the Elysee Hotel an average rating - but the stay was overall very good. The location of the hotel is great and the price can not be beat for Central London. I gave the hotel an average rating because or a few reasons: 1. The sheets on the bed are very scratchy. At least for me - I have super sensitive skin. 2. The internet charge is a bit inconvenient. 3. The rooms are really small. I knew they would be small for Europe, but these were very small with two large suitcases. The pros of this hotel are the location and the price. If you are going to London and have no intention of staying in your hotel then this is a great place to try. There is a great laundromat down the street and there is a local pub a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer028
Reviews.Content: If you after basic, clean, tidy and great location. This is what you after.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tamitzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysee Hotel for six nights. Yes, it was small, but it wasn't the smallest hotel that we have ever stayed in. It was comfortable and clean and the location can't be beat. The only negative would probably be the condition of the carpet in the room - it was rather dingy and I didn't want to walk on it with bare feet. Other than that everything else was satisfactory. It was within a few minutes' walk to Lancaster Gate tube station and a ten minute walk to Paddington Station, so it was an excellent base for London and surrounding area sightseeing. Many tour companies pick up at the nearby Corus Hotel (much more expensive), so that is also a plus. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. The breakfast was the same everyday - scrambled or hard boiled eggs, beans, toast, jelly, yogurt, juice, coffee - which was fine for us. Right across the street is the Mitre Pub and a block away and around the corner is the Swan Pub - both had excellent fish and chips and the meat pies at the Swan were quite tasty. All in all, we would recommend a stay at the Elysee Hotel - a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Margo052
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff welcoming and breakfast good. Pub opposite served great meals. Handy for transport and just a short walk to Kensington gardens. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem near Hyde park and tube”
Reviews.Author: hihotravels
Reviews.Content: Elysee is walking disatance from the train station direct from Heathrow. It is also only feet from the tube and across the street from beautiful Hyde Park. If you go through Lancaster gate and follow the path through the beautiful gardens you will end up across near Harrods. Many local pubs with wonderful food and drink all around the hotel. Rooms are small but extremely clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure our five day stay was great. I loved the location. When I go back to London I will stay there again. Also small grocery and drug store down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel for acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: Kinginrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. After reading last reviews here I was bit scared but I must say, we were satisfied. Our room was on 3rd floor. The room was not very big, but on the other hand there was enough space where to put our big luggage. The room was very clean, cleaning service provided every day. Bathroom also small, but clean and acceptable. The only problem was very low water pressure, so it was very hard to take shower, washing long hair was almost impossible. Also satelite TV offered very low number of chanels, but this is triviality. Walls are very thin, so you can hear TV and voices from the next room. There was a safe box which we found useful. Breakfast served in the ground floor was simple - not continental in my eyes, but you could eat enough. They offered baked beans, mashed eggs, hard boiled eggs, toasts, jams, butter, cheese, 3 types of cereals with milk and some canned fruits. Breakfast was served from 7:30 till 9:30, but some of the guest came late at 9:30 and the staff had no problem with that. Staff was very nice and helpful, providing coffee and tea. We were missing some saussages or ham coz the breakfast became quite monotonous every day. For late coming it was sometimes difficult to find cheese or juice - they were run out. Reception staff was ok, adviced you when you needed. The wifi internet is not free. You could have it for 24 hours - 5 pounds, 72 hours - 10 pounds and 7 days - 25 pounds. They also offer shorter rates (1/2 hour and 1 hour) but these are only for using hotel computers in the lobby. I found internet quite expensive in comparison with the price for one night. There is a nice pub Mitre across the street and Sheila cafe with very pleasant staff and nice offer of sandwiches. The hotel also provides taxi drives to Kings Cross and St. Pancras for 20 pounds. The biggest advantage of this hotel is the location - 5 minut walk from Lancaster Gate tube and one station from Oxford street. All in all, it is very difficult to find acceptable hotel in central London and I would rate this as the better one.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: JosephLondoner
Reviews.Content: I live in Central London and required a hotel room as the house was overflowing with guests. Recent reviews had caused concern but checking out various other hotels it seems London room rates have gone crazy.Even a dump one star hotels quoted £160 per night so at £120 per night quoted for Elysee it was worth taking a chance. What a pleasant surprise and such a gem. Clean rooms, crisp white linen, flat screen TV. The Staff tried extremely hard to make sure that all was well. We were a little late for breakfast at 9.40 but that was no issue with the breakfast staff. The breakfast was great, ok no English fry up but much more that a simple continental that one now expects in budget chains. And the shower pressure, something that I rate as important was wonderful. My view for recent spate of negative review is that in recent months London hoteliers have substantially bumped up room rates and this I believe has increased expectations. Overall I think we had great value. Just remember that high speed wifi internet is free in the lobby and bar area but chargeable in the rooms ( I think £5 for 24 hours)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, very small”
Reviews.Author: mels4711
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, with nowhere to put your suitcase, and no drawers keep your clothes, just a small hanger area with 4 hangers. Carpet was dirty, but otherwise a clean room with A/C which was nice. The hotel was loud with doors banging all the time, and the motion light sensors that don't come on until your almost to your door. They had a nice free breakfast down in the basement though. However there is a little cafe right in front of the hotel called Sheila's, where all the cabbies go, great for a bite to eat! A must do! Also the Mitre Pub right across the street which was very good as well. But you do have to pay for Wifi. Good quiet location near Hyde Park, with the Lancaster Gate Underground station right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “We will not be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne_caudy
Reviews.Content: We were quite let down with this hotel. We spent ages trying to find a hotel to meet our needs to enjoy a few days away in London. One important thing to us is the use if the internet when away. The website made out that free wifi was available, however upon arrival we discovered that we had to pay. Breakfast was a disappointment. Continental breakfast was advertised on booking. However, this consisted of 3 different cereals, tired looking tinned fruit, yogurts, boiled eggs left out in a tray by the yogurts to go cold, bread to toast yourself, scrambled egg and baked beans. No signs of traditional continental breakfast items such as bacon, sausages, croissants, fresh fruit. Breakfast hours were 07:30 till 09:30 which were not convenient when away on a holiday. We turned up for breakfast at 09:00 to find they were already packing away. Breakfast tables were small and cluttered with too many jams and big sugar bowl. We completed a comment card and on departure popped it in the box, however this did not seem to have been emptied in a long while as it was jam packed. Room and bathroom were on the small side, not easy to move around when 2 are trying to get dressed in the morning. Advertised satellite television, however very basic channels, though we did have one or two sports channels.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Jean06345
Reviews.Content: While the hotel lacks the charm of some, the small rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. It was an affordable, acceptable alter attire to some of the accommodations in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: mookie1226
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I guess we should've known seeing as it was only a 3-star rated hotel (and after looking back at some of the reviews...eek!) But it definitely is not somewhere you will want to stay for your honeymoon! We were here for 4 days and enjoyed the stay for the most part (the location was spectacular). The staff was less than friendly and the room was smaller than most economy European hotel rooms that we had been in. We told ourselves that we were only going to be sleeping in this room, which after seeing the room, we made sure that was all we did. Tiny, tiny bathroom and it was basically just a room with a king size bed and no walking space. We couldn't even find room for our luggage so we had to jump over it ever morning and night!! Decent hotel, just tread carefully!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,close to Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: glad1947
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has European style. Hyde Park is two minutes down the road,bus service on the same road as the park, Bayswater Road and is with easy walking distance of Lancaster and Paddington tube stations. They offer a free breakfast but we never ate there as we were out and about early . The room is small so don't be surprised. One wardrobe to hang things, ask for extra hangers. Bathroom is efficient with nice tiled shower, small vanity but room underneath for toiletries. The staff is very friendly and helpful.Great Pub across the road, The Mitre and also The Swan around the corner. Several restaurants on Craven Terrace. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Windchill-41
Reviews.Content: Small but efficient rooms (but watch your head in the front rooms on the fourth floor). In room safe, kettle and hair dryer. The self-serve breakfast offered cereal, yougurt, fruit cocktail, hard boiled eggs, cheese, juice, scrabled eggs, beans, toast and coffee or tea. About 3 blocks from Paddington (7 minutes) and less to Lancaster Gate - Central line tube station. Wi-fi available for additional cost. Great pub across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, nice hot shower”
Reviews.Author: fifi_lamourUk
Reviews.Content: There are only really two things I need from a hotel - a decent bed and a decent shower. It amazes me how many hotels can't get this right. Now, let's be honest, the Elysee Hotel is not the smartest hotel in the Bayswater/Lancaster Gate area. It doesn't have the marble pillars or the liveried doormen. There is no gym or spa centre. There is no Michelin-starred restaurant. But what is does offer is clean and comfortable accommodation, the all-important comfortable bed and a nice hot shower to get you ready for the day. Our basement room was basic, but had everything we needed. It was small, and the bathroom was a one-in, one-out set-up but this is London - you pay a premium for room space here. The staff are polite and helpful. The hotel is well-kept, bearing in mind the age of the building. The location was ideal for our purposes, situated in a quiet street but with useful shops and businesses nearby and within easy walking distance to 3 tube stations - Lancaster Gate, Queensway and Paddington. All in all, this is a quirky little place and is excellent value for money considering what you'd pay in one of the "smart" hotels in the area. I'd rather save my money for enjoying myself in London than blow it all on a swanky room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: PG81
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Elysee hotel for 3 nights. We had a twin room which we found clean and comfortable. The bathroom is nicely updated and spacious. The breakfast was good consisting of toast, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, beans, cereals, yogurt, cheeses, juice, you could help yourself to what you liked. We liked the area, it was quiet and it is close to Hyde Park and the buses and trains are easily accessible. The room was small but it was cozy and we were only there at night to sleep since we were out all day. We were very pleased and it was perfect for a short stay. I recommend going to Lancaster Gate transit station which is close by to buy a daily or weekly transit pass, it is cheaper. Paying for bus and tube fares can be expensive if you pay per trip, the passes allow you unlimited transport on both. The No#148 bus stops at The Houses of Parliament and Westminster Abbey. The No#94 bus takes you to Oxford Street and Piccadilly Circus and the No#274 bus takes you to the London Zoo and Camden Town which I recommend because it has the famous Camden Markets which is a great place to go, my teenage daughter loved it there, great place for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value, good service and robust breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: bertywoster
Reviews.Content: London hotels are expensive and you do get what you pay for. Location was important for us for this short tourist visit and Elysee is hard to beat for that. Bus and tube connections are very close by and Lanacaster Gate is very well situated to most attractions. It's great being across the road for kensington gardens/hyde park too. The rooms are small and they are not high end by any standards, but we found them very clean and comfortable enough (and we had a cot and a 4 month old baby squeezed in too). The staff are great - very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is pleantiful and good quality - although don't expect the menu to change! Cereals, toast, yoghurt, cheese, scambelled and bolied eggs, baked beans and some fruit salad. We were very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jmc_1230
Reviews.Content: We booked as cheaply as possible with the location a priority to meet up with friends. Although the room was small, it was fine for a place to sleep. Breakfast was fine and the staff friendly, courteous and helpful. We'd recommend for short visits. Superb value for London.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: meikelfromtivon
Reviews.Content: We came to the Elysee after fleeing the hotel we had booked down the road. The rooms are small (understatement of the year) but otherwise I only have positive feedback. The Elysee is clean, quiet, comfortable (just don't try to move in your room), well equipped. The staff are friendly, the breakfast ( English but without meat ) is excellent, the situation is fantastic. What more can you ask for ?

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: opmaFredrikstad
Reviews.Content: This was nice. Great location and friendly staff. The room was small but clean. I thought we were the only guests because it was so quiet, but at breakfast the first morning I saw that we weren't. It's a hotel I will come back to. Ole Petter Martinsen, Fredrikstad, Norway

Reviews.Title: “For a 1 night stay it was cool”
Reviews.Author: illsko415
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean Hotel in a great location. I showed up about an hour earlier before check-in time but they were nice enough to let me check in right away. You have to go up a few stairs to get to the elevator (or lift as they call it) and depending where your room is you might have to go up a few more stairs. I got the basic double bed room and it was SMALL. The bed took up about 80% of the room I pretty much had like a 2 feet clearance if that between the bed and wall to walk around. The bathroom was really small as well. You might want to get a room with 2 twins instead since those rooms are bigger. The room itself was really clean though and if you can oversee the size of the room then I recommend you stay here. When I checked out the guy at the front desk was nice enough to get me a cab and help me with my bags.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: atourist10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in summer 2010, The location was good and the rooms relatively clean but apart from that, there were not really many other good points. The rooms (was staying in a triple) were extremely small and difficult for people to move around in. There were no drawers in which to store clothes and only 3 coat hangers, meaning you virually had to live out of a suitcase. Also there were no place to store the suitcases, meaning that even more of the preciuos floor space was taken up. The walls were very thin so we could hear people in adjacent rooms having a conversation. Also, due to their poor quality it was difficult to completely close our windows meaning that we could hear all the noise from the street below. The breakfast left a lot to be desired. Firstly, the breakfast room was located in the basement of the hotel and was extremely cramped and damp smelling. There was an extremely poor selection of food on offer, a self service toast machine which only seemed to toast the bread on one side, youghurts which were left on a table and had turned warm, eggs and beans and cereal in tube dispensers that looked like it had been there for ages. It would actually better to advertise the hotel as room only. Also found the staff quite unhelpful, especially when asking for a taxi to take us to the station with our small suitcases. I am aware that this hotel is in Central London and costs are bound to be higher but I honestly cant say where this hotel gets its 3star rating from as I have stayed in lower rated hotels before that are far better.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: KareninBoca
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Elysee, and I was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The room was small, but extremely clean. The air conditioning was a godsend in the heat of the summer. The location cannot be beat, especially if you are traveling by Heathrow Express. Additionally, the neighborhood is not touristy, but offers great restaurant and pubs in every price range. Transportation of every sort (except boat) is available within 3 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Nam0
Reviews.Content: Let's start with location. Peaceful area with couple of shops.A few steps from the subway and Hyde Park. The staff was excellent. Quite friendly , helpful chatty and also hardworking . Breakfast was really bad because of its poor variety. The breakfast room was extremely tiny and what is worse : it was placed in the basement in an old,tight room. As for the rooms, they were not spacious at all. Instead , they were tiny and miserable. The bathroom had a really small sink . Air-conditioner was available which is a good point especially when the weather is hot. Matresses were not really comfortable.A mini bar was unavailable.Cleanliness was ok.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: michKent
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night and would stay again.staff were attentive,location was excellent 3 mins from lancaster gate tube & 3 mins from hyde park.air con in the room and breakfast was basic but okay.Only downside was the room was very small.not to bad for two females in twin room but would have been to squashed for two men or a mixed couple.But how long do you really want to stay in your room when your visiting london !

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD VALUE AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: londonlover68
Reviews.Content: I have been in a lot of hotels in London and I can say that the 'Elysee' is really a good one. The room was tiny but very cosy, very clean and quiet. The bed was excellent and if I could I would have taken home the cushions (lol). The breakfast was excellent, much better than in a lot of hotels in this price rate. The staff was so friendly, they really gave me the feeling that I was a little bit 'at home' in their hotel. Thank you all for being so kind and helpfull. On top of that the 'Elysee' is located nearby the metro 'Lancaster Gate', an excellent location for those who travel with the 'Eurostar'. If I go back to London, this will be ''''my'''' hotel!! And I can recommend it to everybody. I was there for 6 days and I was sad to leave... says enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: ProjectsChantilly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions, and will continue to do so. You can't beat the price and prime location in the heart of London, close to all the major attractions. The staff is always professional, friendly and courteous. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well-maintained. (Yes, they may be smaller than what we're used to in the US, but this is London after all!) And you get a very nice English Breakfast for the price. In short, you can't go wrong with the Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money in london”
Reviews.Author: CanterburyKentishMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife last week for two nights on a weekend break to London. Our room was on the second floor facing Hyde Park (not all rooms in the hotel face the park), which was a real treat. There was an unexpected heatwave in London so the air-conditioning was godsend. I could not really fault the room: clean, crisp white linen, flat screen TV, in room safe (a must for me when travelling) and tea/coffee facility. The breakfast was adequate: scrambled eggs, baked beans, yogurt, toast, and cheese. I am not one for a fry up and this suited me fine. The breakfast times 7.30-9.30, we got there at 9.40 one morning and were happily served! The resident’s bar, well nothing to write home about, but across the road is an excellent pub, The Mitre which has an Old English charm. Overall a very pleasant stay with polite and helpful staff. IT Canterbury

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: centurini
Reviews.Content: My entire experience at this hotel was terrible. The location is not bad, the rooms were small but that is not unexpected for London. That is the only somewhat possitive comment I can make about this horrible experience. The staff is unhelpful and unknowledgeable. Every question I had could not be answered. We were told they could only give us one key per room even though there were several of us staying. The internet vouchers were useless and could not even be used in the rooms consistently. When I tried to get help the office staff said "this is the first time this has ever happened" and could not do anything about issues without talking to the owner of the hotel by phone. As for the room: the bathroom floor had ductape between tiles to keep them in place. Needless to say, when stepped on they moved around. The floor was always dirty in the rest of the room and my bed had crumbs in between the sheets. SAVE YOURSELF THE AGGRAVATION AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - AWFUL Room!!”
Reviews.Author: lydia4m0
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and I spent two nights in the Elysee Hotel. We booked a triple room (one double, one twin) for what seemed a reasonable rate for the location. The location was fab (less than a block away from Hyde Park and just a few blocks from several tube stations), but the room was by far the worst I have ever experienced. We were on the top floor, the room was VERY musty smelling (we kept the window open the entire stay in the middle of December), and impossibly small...only one person could stand in the room at a time, while the other two had to sit on the bed to make room for the one moving about. The only place to store luggage was in front of the room door as the room was so narrow to put a suitcase elsewhere would require climbing over the beds to get to the bathroom! The carpet was stained and in poor repair as were the duvets and drapes. The room was not very clean. We didn't spend much time in the room and due to our tight travel itinerary, did not have time to seek out a new location. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel and based on the cleanliness of the room, I would have been afraid to.... The clerk at the desk was reasonably polite but again, the condition of the room in relation to the cost was unbelievably poor. I definitely WOULD NOT stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: Bibi321
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel include the staff - polite and helpful and the location and that's about it. Rooms are extremely small. We have booked it a month in advance and got a room in the basement under reception where you can hear people walking all night long. Breakfast is served 7.30-9.30 and is very poor. In fact it was so bad that we only had it the first morning.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Bar not functional”
Reviews.Author: splotto
Reviews.Content: Receptionist on arrival very helpful and polite. Double Room 10B spotlessly clean, measured 3.5 Meters by 2 Meters with a small corridor 1 meter by 3 meters . Bathroom 1.5 by 1.5 meters Breakfast average, but OK if you filled yourself with toast.(otherwise scrambled egg and beans) Location, excellent and just around the corner in Craven Road a Chinese restaurant The Mandarin was brilliant. Food, price, surroundings and service of the higjhest order. Dissapointed with the bar. No draught beer or mixers (tonics etc). Shelves filled with empty beer bottles and reception porter also bar person. The Bar was there just for the show

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great value”
Reviews.Author: amethystam
Reviews.Content: My sister and I are from Singapore. Despite us being petite Asians and me travelling frequently to Japan and staying in their small rooms, I was still taken aback by Elysee Hotel's match-box size room. Other than that the service was good, rooms were clean, breakfast was very good, and location was fantastic! Definitely great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wonton_9
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was small, and the bathroom tiny, but it's Europe; that's the way it is. We were very happy with this hotel. It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, A/C in room w/ remote control, in-room safe, flat screen TV, and the location was great. It is just around the corner from the Lancaster Gate tube station and is basically right across the street from the beautiful Hyde Park (walk through the park to get to Buckingham Palace). The neighborhood is very nice, quiet, and clean. There is a pub across the street, some small stores, and cafes nearby also (I would recommend the Swan pub around the corner for its history and atmosphere). The included breakfast was great (a little different for Americans, but that's all part of the experience). They had scrambled eggs, pork and beans, cereals, toast, juice, etc. - plus they have people that come around to give you coffee and tea and clear your table! There is free Wi-Fi internet in the lobby (we connected w/ our laptop and iPod) which worked just fine for our needs (checking e-mail, banking, etc.). We couldn't have asked for a better hotel and the great breakfast really saved us money on food.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay, for the price”
Reviews.Author: Donna9197
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, but very small, with a tiny bathroom consisting of a shower stall, sink and toilet. The hotel is quiet at night and air-conditioned. The location is only 2 or 3 blocks from the tube station, and there is a nice pub across the street and several small shops nearby to buy small items. Hyde Park is just a block away, which is a nice place to visit. The staff is courteous and speak broken English fairly well. The breakfast is mediocre and the same everyday, including the Rod Stewart CD that plays on and on. There is a laundry next door where the guy up front makes sandwiches. Don't make the mistake of going there to use the dryer without also using the washers, as the grouchy owner will set you straight. If you are a larger size person, I would not recommend the Elysee. But, if you are willing to sacrifice space and niceties for a well-priced and clean bed at night with a free mediocre breakfast, then you should consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: yorksramblingrose
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel was very clean. We would stay here again although our room was rather small and there was nowhere to put our suitcase. It was very warm during our stay so the air conditioning in our room was very welcome. The breakfast was adequate and you could easily fill up ready for a days' sight seeing. The nearest tube station is only a couple of minutes walk away and the nearby streets have a pub, Italian restaurants, cafes, small supermarket and shops. Kensington Park was just over the road so for us this was an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: mindfulfawn
Reviews.Content: my partner and I are regular visitors to London usually on leisure trips so have stayed in many hotels. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived in the area, very upmarket and quiet and close to all places of interest. The receptionist was polite and gave us the keys to our room. Everything looked clean, tidy and as expected. When we arrived to our room we were horrified at the size you could literally turn round in the room and that was about it. The reason they have flat screen TVs on the wall is because they will not fit anywhere else! However, the room was spotless and adequate for one nights stay. We went down to the bar to have a drink and maybe something to eat but we were told that it was closed because it was not busy enough (this at 8pm at night) so did not go down well as we were tired from a long day of activities and had to go elsewhere for a drink and food. Breakfast is certainly nothing to write home about very basic and definitely not what id call continental unless thats what you'd call cereal and toast. Overall a decent, clean place to lay your head but not one for relaxing and enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: djnToronto
Reviews.Content: The rooms are indeed small, but when in London you should not be spending much waking time in a hotel room anyway. Everything was clean and comfortable, and the air conditioner worked wonders during the recent heat wave. The location is excellent; only a two minute walk from Lancaster Gate tube, and about five minutes from Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “Small and clean”
Reviews.Author: TeeBow
Reviews.Content: Tiny room but for sleeping it was fine, great location. Staff was ok not real friendly or unfriendly. TeeBow

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant unplanned stay.”
Reviews.Author: KareninBoca
Reviews.Content: I arrived in London with my sister and teenage son all set to stay at a neighboring hotel. Upon arrival to our planned hotel, we were informed they didn't have our reservation. I went into panic mode, as London was very busy it w-as Wimbledon finals week. I went to the Elysee, and they were able to squeeze us in. They bent over backwards to accommodate us. We had to change rooms three times over our eight night stay, but we were extremely grateful to have shelter! They were even able to accommodate us on one night when we thought we'd have to stay down the street because there were no vacancies. The rooms are small, but this is very typical of European hotels. We had 5 different rooms between the 3 of us. Each was very clean, and had enough storage room for 3 people who overpacked. The rooms are fully refurbished - modern bathroom fixtures, and marvelous air-conditioning. We were there during a heat wave so it was a god send. The beds were comfortable, with crisp clean sheets each night. the breakfast staff was lovely and accommodating. Overall, we were extremely pleased with the Elysee, and intend to stay here again on our next visit. BTW- The location is great - many convenience shops on the street, laundry 2 doors down, and a 7 minute walk (with lots of luggage) to Paddington. A 3 minute walk to the Lancaster Gate tube as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: thehomemommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009 and it was a good experience. As previous reviews have said, this is in an EXCELLENT location - 2 minutes from the Underground - Central line, 2 minutes from Hyde Park, and on the same street as some excellent pubs and cafes. It is around the corner from a pharmacy, and is about a 10 minute walk to Paddington Station. We booked a double room and was quite small (at least in American standards) - it was just about fit a full size bed, a desk, and a small closet. The full breakfast was helpful but I kind of got sick of it by the last day - the fruit they offer appears to be canned mixed fruit. The coffee and tea were great. The staff was extremely helpful in our kind of oddball requests. Please note that even if your room appears to have been already serviced by housekeeping, they may not be finished. I was woken up twice in the afternoon by housekeeping (and didn't put up the "do not disturb" sign because I didn't think we needed to). So if you plan on visiting your room in the middle of the day, be sure to put the Do Not Disturb sign up. The hotel does have a bar (that appears to be operated by receptionist staff) but I saw absolutely no one visiting it during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice location , enough for a small trip in london”
Reviews.Author: melle-k
Reviews.Content: very nice location (lancaster gate and paddington station very near. to visit and to go outside the evening, that's good. direct line..2 stops to oxford.. you can cross hyde park and you arrive in buckingham palace..westminster etc.. small room but to sleep its ok. no noise for us ( 7 th floor ) internet access. breakfast ok but small and noisy room. nice staff, and you can leave your baggages the kast day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed hotel - small room but cost lower than most, helpful staff, good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: mytravelingways
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this little hotel may be small but they were very clean, had nice amenities like a TV, phone, hairdryer, a/c (something you don't always get) and an in room safe. The price was reasonable (as reasonable as you get in London - about 85 pounds) and it is close to a pub (a little too close but still fine - nothing stays open too late), close to Paddington Station/buses and Hyde Park, close to lots of little shops/restaurants/pharmacy/deli. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. They serve breakfast (yogurt, toast, cereals, eggs, beans, fruit) and have a computer (coin operated) in the lobby. There is wi-fi for your own computer. Get a room with a double bed if you are traveling alond and a room with 2 beds if there are two of you. Bathroom with shower. I would stay there again. For those getting picked up for tours, the buses don't stop there, but they do stop at the Corus Hotel which is 3 minutes around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Room tiny - even for Paddington Bear!”
Reviews.Author: CulturalAttache
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms (really tiny) Free Wifi does not reach all the rooms. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, but tiny”
Reviews.Author: Trondheim10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, room with double bed. Very tiny room and bathroom. Almost as I couldn't turn around. Bed was good on one side but broken on the other side. The remote was attached to the table, that was bad. The tv was to high up on the wall so the picture was a little dark when lying/sitting on the bed. I had to stand up to see the tv normal. The internet connection on the pc in lobby was slow and it was expensive to use. Go to area near paddington and use computers there. Cheaper and better. Paddington station was 6-7 minutes walk away from the hotel. I think that is a little too far. But the hotel was cheap. I payed under £130 for 2 nights incl. breakfast. Very friendly staff. You could notice that they want to help you and they like it (couldn't say that about the staff at the much expensiver hotel I stayed in earlier in London (The cranley)). Clean room, breakfast was good (friendly staff here also, here to help you and make you comfortable). Breakfast was also much better (and cheaper) than The Cranley. sum up: + breakfast price very friendly staff all over clean - location could be a litte better tiny room remote was attached to table tv too high up on the wall (dark picture) internet in lobby one bed was broken Don't think I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent size room, very clean & superb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterBusybody
Reviews.Content: I booked a compact single room (it says in their description that it is compact) and had shower, toilet, air condition, electric heater, telephone, kettle,LCD TV. I do not understand what the previous lady was complaining about. If she wants a bigger room then pay for it and get a double room. Breakfast was also super. Meant to be continental but surprising there was scramble eggs, boiled eggs, beans in addition. The staff were wonderful all round. The bar is open in the evening was a wonderful place to chill out with a large screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself from the single!”
Reviews.Author: MissElitistPiggy
Reviews.Content: I was positively delighted as I arrived to the hotel, as the staff was so friendly and helpful and I even received a complimentary map. Unfortunately the friendliness of the staff was limited to the two guys working on day shift. Everything else after the reception was..more or less a disappointment. The room was absolutely the tiniest HOTEL room I have ever seen! It wasn't much bigger than a broom closet! If I placed my luggage on the floor, I couldn't open the door and had to jump over it to get to the bath"room". Every time I wanted out, I had to close my luggage and place it next to the bed or in front of the toilet seat. There was not even a sliding door between the bath and the room itself, so all the steam, smells, everything spread to the room. The bath was refurbished, luckily, but since the shower nozzle could not be adjusted, you couldn't take a shower without getting your hair wet. The shower booth was so tiny that if you moved or turned, you touched the walls immediately! If you left the door open, the whole place got wet. There was no place to hang your towel or place your clothes or even toiletries. There wasn't even a proper coat rack to hang your longer coat or any longer pieces of clothing. Well, there were two hangers, so... There was no extra seating in the room, no chair, nothing, but on the other hand, there wouldn't have been room either... The only place to put your toiletries or shopping or anything was by the headboard and the shelf was so narrow! There was a tea kettle, but I just couldn't stomach the thought of drinking anything coming out of it. Also all the walls were stained and the carpeting so worn. On the night of my arrival, I woke to the freezing temperature in the room. The radiator was not working, neither could I turn on the heat pump on the wall. When I complained about it, it took hours before anyone could come and see either of the appliances. There was no extra blanket either. In the morning I realised why it had been so darn cold - the window was BROKEN behing the curtains!! There had been some sticky tape over the cracks, but they'd dried and dropped to the sill ages ago. Later on it was revealed that there was something wrong with the plugs in the room - how safe was I! The breakfast was lousy. Cereal, toast, canned fruits (which I saw no one touching), beans and scrambled/boiled eggs. You only got eggs and beans if you happened to go to breakfast early enough. How on earth can a hotel run out of breakfast!?! No apologies were made. They are advertising for their pub, but at least I couldn't find one. Perhaps it was the door that was closed next to the brekkie room? If you're accustomed to the 13.00 or 14.00 late check outs, don't dream of such in this place! It's 11.00 in best case and getting even that depends on who you're asking. All in all, the place was a disgrace, as so much more could be achieved with quite little changes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony12341234
Reviews.Content: I visited London in January for business, and I was looking for a hotel in the center of London. A friend had already stayed here, and he was shocked by the competitive pricing and the location. When they said on their website that they were a stone's throw away from Hyde Park, we thought it was more marketing. The hotel itself, from the exterior, was slightly 'shabby.' However, the room we were given was both spacious and very modern. It was perfect, and the interior of the hotel appeared to be recently renovated. The attitude of the staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was appetising. I will definately go back there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: FatbankD
Reviews.Content: This is a non pretentious hotel very recently renovated. It was all perfect and clean although small. Small elevator, small room, small shower etc... in my case, I just needed a place to sleep for the night so it was perfect. It is walking distance from the tube and Hyde Park for jogging. Even breakfast was good. I would really recommend it for traveling on a budget in excellent conditions and without fancy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Methos
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, refurbished, clean rooms although small, clean bathroom, good location, nice neighborhood (Hyde Park, The Mitre Pub). Continental breakfast included boiled eggs. New elevator for 8 persons. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Elysée Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yezzie
Reviews.Content: We had a double room at Elysée Hotel and the room was actually in better shape than we thought that it would be. I wouldn't call it roomy, but still not small. It's definitely okay by european standard. Our room was at the basement, which was a little boring though the only window we had was too high for actually be able to see something from it. Bathroom was clean but the door to the shower couldn't be closed properly. Great location! Couple minutes walk to Lancaster Gate (subway) and couple of more minutes to Paddington Station. A budget hotel I'd recomemd for people that wanna save some money in London!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Deebow
Reviews.Content: Booked triple room at this hotel through GTA Hotels. Not the best hotel I've stayed in but did the job. Room was tiny for a triple, basic but clean. Excellent location, 2 mins from Lancaster gate tube and 5 mins from Paddington. 2 mins from Hyde Park. Didn't get up in time for continental breakfast so had a £2.99 full English at Raffles cafe, on Craven Road just around the corner (highly recommended). The only major downside, was that the walls are extremely thin, so wasn't happy when we were woken up at 1.30am by guests in the room next door. Could hear every single word. However, would probably stay there again as it was a good price for a central London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elysee is OK”
Reviews.Author: PlanmanVancouver
Reviews.Content: Hotels in London are notoriously expensive, and rooms are notoriously small. The Elysee is a budget hotel that does most things rights. The room was tiny, but well-designed, and the bathroom was brand new and spotlessly clean. The room we had was oddly configured with the window at the end of a corridor - while this made the room somewhat dark, it did allow for a bit of a "dressing area" (complete with hair dryer and mirror.) Staff were efficient, but pleasant. The breakfast included was perfectly adequate and the staff in the breakfast room were very cordial. Desk staff allowed us to store our luggage on our day of departure, which was much appreciated. NOTE: the lift was out of service during our visit - to the hotel's credit this information was prominently displayed on their website, and was no surprise to us on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Daylight robbery.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen12
Reviews.Content: We are just back from London, and stayed in this hotel. They gave us room 19A, which was a triple room, but it had no window. The next morning we realised it did indeed have a window, but it was down a corridor! It allowed in no day light, and it would be impossible to know when it was day or night. Despite having told the hotel we were travelling with our learning disabled daughter, we asked if we could have breakfast in our room, even if one of us went down to the breakfast room to get it and they refused point blank. They would not allow us to do that, which put added pressure on us while away from home. The lift is still broken, and the reception staff chatted among each other and were indifferent to guests when we saw them. It was certainly possible to get better accomodation for the money in that area but they requested payment up front, so we didn't pursue that avenue. Generally seedy, narrow, not for the more full of figure. Nooky, dark in the corridors and breakfast staff didn't know very much english. We asked for some toast and they brought us one slice of toasted bread, it took some negotiating to actually get enough toast for our family...one slice at a time..... Be prepared or stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patrick44
Reviews.Content: The Elysee is a small Hotel in the Lancaster Gate area across from Kensington Gardens and off the Bayswater Rd. It is also close to Paddington station. The rooms are newly refurbished and while small are carefully fitted to give you all you need in a short stay hotel. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are also well fitted and the tilework is attractive and tasteful. The breakfasts are good and on par with the usual European standard. The staff are friendly, professional, helpful and take a pride in their work. This is a vast improvement on the traditional English "hotel" and is far removed from the "Fawlty Towers" which one can still find lurking in this country. There are some good restaurants close by and the Mitre pub across the street can be recommended in all respects apart from the ridiculous early closing time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: MichelleOrla
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely stay, i went with my mum and stayed for 5 nights. the lifts are currently out of bounds, as it is being replaced so they put us on the ground floor. the bar was also closed while we were there, but that didnt bother us because we were out all day. the room was small but it was perfectly adequate. we were very near lancaster gate station so we had no problems travel wise the kensington gardens are pretty much opposite where we were staying, and it just a short walk to hyde park, which is right beside this, and there you'll find The Princess Diana Memorial Fountain i didnt book through the hotel website itself as i actually got it cheaper on another website called easytobook. note: when you arrive at the hotel you have to pay on arrival

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't good; it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: banglagirl
Reviews.Content: Elysee Hotel staff saved me after I had missed my plane due to vandalism on the train tracks to Stansted Airport. I was very lucky; they had a few rooms available when I checked in. Check-in went very smooth. The room was very clean; I was very pleasantly surprised. The bed was definitely the most comfortable I have ever slept in in London. Television was great; lcd-screen. They have CNN, Sky News and also French and Italian news stations. Very good. I believe you can switch to radio, too. I haven't tried that though. At my room, a clean bedroom was offered. Plenty of clean, white towels - very good. Staff was very friendly. I don't really believe the comments about mice, rude staff members and so on. There are just always people who feel like bringing others down because they're not happy themselves. Everything was ok at the Elysee Hotel. It worked for me. Breakfast was ok, too, by the way. I don't eat that much in the morning so some cerial and yoghurt was all fine with me. I will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elysee Hotel and their staff”
Reviews.Author: char821
Reviews.Content: First let me say hello to phillip,maria and to all the wonderful staff. I want to thank the hotel for a wonderful stay. I had booked other accomodations and it fell thru and i was able toget a triple room with Elysee Hotel. It is very close by and there is a laudromat two doors down with a great sandwhich shop too. (note: the dryers at the laudromat take forever to dry and will cost you about 4 pounds for two loads) As far as to the hotel the room we had was a triple and it was great. The maids were great, our room was cleaned every day and there is nice soap and shampoo/conditioner tolietries in the bathroom. it was nice having wifi and tea/coffee making facilities in the room. You do get continental breakfast but you get boiled egg, 2 choices of fruit, yogurt, toast,cereal, milk,coffee and juice and the ladies who serve you are fantastic!!! i hope to come back to London soon. Advice for travelers u might want to bring plenty of pounds currency it would be cheaper in the long run. You can use your cc in London but everything will be converted double to USD so if you pay 10 pds in london u will be charged $20 on your card. I hope this helps. Oh there is two tube stations just around the corner and 3 blocks up the street. And the very charming staff will call a taxi for u if you need one. There is a great pub across the street. The hotel bar is great too. Look foward to seeing staff at Hotel Elysee again.

Reviews.Title: “Elysee Saved us”
Reviews.Author: JCO725
Reviews.Content: Elysee saved our stay in London, I booked Oxford Hotel for 68 ounds which is at the same street of Elysee, which have rooms that are not for human plus they are terrible and dirty, then on the way to the tube, we passed by Elysee, and all we have to do is add another 10 pounds for a wonderful, warm, clean and helpful staff. the breakfast was also good, yoghurt, toast, milk, cereals, coffee and tea, fruits as well. all in all, if you are looking for a nice, clean,, cheap hotel in london, this is for you, lancaster tube is just 5 minutes away, theres a nearby restaurant that serves nice fish and chips - The Swan. 2 doors away, they have laundry shop in case you need one. a block away you see a lot of local shops, grocery. stay in room 3, its the best i think =)

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of mucking about but OK”
Reviews.Author: zeus08
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent approximately two weeks in London - our first week before hitting Europe and our last week before heading home. We chose this hotel as it's close to Paddington Station & Hyde Park. Of course, the price was also appealing. We were aware of rooms being "bisou" (small) and rather dull ambience but when in London, "beggers can't be chooses" so to speak. Our first room was quite small but OK for the price. However, noise became an issue on many nights with loud guests as the room was around the corner from reception. Most of the staff were OK but one lady in particular had excellent service. The most unfortunate thing about our stay at The Elysees occurred when in our last week. Our first stay was in a twin room close to where the hotel staff went for a smoke so the room smelt like cigarettes (we witnessed staff smoking on the fire escape/back stairs). The toilet was amusing as in it took several attempts to flush before anything went down and I didn't enjoy putting my feet on the side of the shower to go to the toilet. However, I'm sure the renovations have improved the bathrooms. After a quick 2 days in Bath, we were excited to find out that we would be staying in one of the renovated rooms which turned out to be a lot better than the rooms we previously had. Unfortunately, on our last night, we headed back to the hotel in the afternoon to find out that we had been kicked out of our room, our luggage as well as all of our other bits and pieces had been moved into another room by one of their staff and that we would be sharing a double room (with a small double bed). This room faced the pub across the road and I couldn't get to sleep because of the noise and the incredibly uncomfortable bed. I was just glad to be leaving the hotel the next day. We complained to the staff and they didn't seem to care. We were told that they overbooked and even had to send other people to another hotel. One of the staff members overheard and whispered to me that "see how our hotel is run?" and went on to roll her eyes. I am sure that rooms have improved but because of the lack of empathy from the staff and moving us every couple of days, I would not go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Amy101Germany
Reviews.Content: In November, my boyfriend and I decided to venture into London again, and we stayed in the same hotel as we did previously. As we wanted to see the centre of London as opposed to the outskirts, we stayed in this hotel situated in a prime location in Central London. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful throughout our stay. The room, whilst somewhat small, was comfortable and clean with facilities one would expect from a 3 star hotel, such as: hairdryer, tea/coffee facilites, ac etc. The breakfast could be improved but was adequeate. On the whole; we had a pleasant stay there again, and it was excellent to see the improvements since the last time we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near Oxford St.”
Reviews.Author: seibo2830
Reviews.Content: For convenience this hotel is in excellent proximity to Hyde Park and Oxford Street. Nice contemporary room, good size, clean, with a flat screen TV.. Good value for the money and a helpful staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust this people!”
Reviews.Author: framel
Reviews.Content: I had planned to travel to London from 7th december to 9th december 2007 and decided to search an hotel close enough to the centre and especially to Oxford Street. I've been to London many times before but this time I really wanted a very convenient location and a couple of months before my travel I booked two standard double rooms throught the hotel website. I guaranteed my booking with a credit card and received an email confirmation from the hotel the next day. Twenty days before my departure I received an "automatic" email from the hotel saying that my reservation had been cancelled. I immediately sent an email to the hotel to ask for more information about this but got no reply. I therefore decided to phone them and the lady I spoke to claimed there had been a problem and they were going to contact me again the following day. I received an email from the hotel staff claiming that there had surely been a mistake as the reservation had been cancelled for no reason at all but they couldn't do anything to help me and they even suggested to find an alternative accommodation!! They didn't apologize or provide an alternative accommodation, as a professional hotel should do! And surely the booking wasn't cancelled by me or my fellow mates! I was really disappointed as the hotel staff showed no customer service skills at all and I finally had to book an hotel with was located in east london, about 30 minutes by tube from the city centre. What I think is that the hotel was overbooked and they decided to cancel my reservation in order to sell my standard rooms as "Superior" rooms. I would really avoid this hotel again and I would never reccommend anyone I know to be their guest!

Reviews.Title: “Mice!”
Reviews.Author: davenport5577
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute for a stay in London. It was awful. The pictures on sites make it look nice; but it certainly isn't worthy of it's alleged 3* rating. Firstly there was extensive building works going on throughout the hotel; which wasn't mentioned on any booking. My room was billed as delux; but it was not; it was basic. There was a shower; but no bath and though the room was a fair size it had a double bed and 2 singles. I had not expected to be using a tripple room. The TV reception was poor and most channels were fuzzy. There was no radio or other entertainment options. The bar appeared to be closed throughout; though this may have been to do with the refurbishment works. The finish throughout the hotel was shabby. There was a hole in on of my walls with wires poking through from the other room. Breakfast was a very basic continental. The toast was barely even toasted and was cold. I was given a cold boiled egg and the only other option was cereal. My main concern was MICE! I spotted a trap under the dresser. And at night I could hear them scuttling around obviously in my room. It made getting to sleep unlikely. The only thing to recommend it was it's excellent location; close to the tube and Hyde Park. It's verycheap by London standards; but please don't waste your money as there are better places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: CHEMENG
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from London, having stayed 4 days in the Elysee hotel. I booked this hotel, because of its convenient location (very close to the tube( Lancaster and Paddington station) and the train (Paddington station)) and its low prices (compared to the other hotels in London, that cost a fortune). I knew from the beginning that it wasn't the best in the west, but i took my chances. To tell the truth, I was a little bit terrified by the reviews of some other travellers in Tripadvisor, and frankly, I was expecting the worst. Nevertheless, we were given a deluxe room on the 1st floor free of charge (we had booked a normal room instead), which was really small (about 25 sqm), but ok in generall (see my candid photos). The bathroom was also small but newly renovated and very clean, which is the most important. There wasn't enough space for the suitcases in the room, but finally we managed. There was also an LCD flat TV, but there weren't many chanels. The breakfast room was in the basement, but was newly painted and was really clean, I didn't detect an unpleasant smell, as some other travellers did. I must admit, though, that the breakfast was rather poor (coffee, tea, orange juice, one hard-boiled egg per person, toasted bread, butter and 5 kinds of marmelade). The staff that served the breakfast was very very kind, friendly and efficient, we had no problem whatsoever. As far as the reception staff is concerned, it may not have been native British, but we had no problem with the communication (they spoke relatively good English and were very friendly and polite). To sum up, the hotel was ok, considering the money we spent for it. It wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed, but I didn't expect something more. In my opinion, I think that the reviews of the travellers in the Tripadvisor site have really brought a result: the administration of the various hotels takes the reviews into consideration, and tries to improve the conditions and the staff attitude of the corresponding hotels. Tripadvisor reviewers, keep up the good work!!! PS. The pub "Mitre" across the street is a must! It has a very nice traditional environment and really good, non-expensive food! I really recommend it (see also the candid photo).

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: steveturnips
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a weekend in the Elysee Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. Firstly, we were shocked at the quality of the deluxe rooms. They were slightly cramped but the amenieties were superb. There was a flat screen Tv with a large selection of challenges. Also, the mattress, although it squeaked, was very confortable. I was travelling on business and the WIFI was superb. It was very useful and fast, although slightly expenisive. Also the in-room safe was helpful. The breakfast was adequate and all the staff were very polite. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you stay in a deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “dont even think about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: theory66
Reviews.Content: Stayed over night with my wife,was given room at back of hotel where there is a building site with non stop noice.Asked if we could be moved but said we would have to pay extra for a deluxe double and was told they couldnt here anything anyway,lies! Room was of a very low standard even for a budget hotel. Breakfast was of nothing special either,the only thing going for this hotel is its location.To not spoil your holiday dont book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with 's' in the middle”
Reviews.Author: jbushie
Reviews.Content: Admittedly our selection of the Elysee was price-driven. In a city like London, it was relatively cheap. But pay peanuts, get monkeys... Three of us booked a triple room - there was barely enough room to walk without smashing hipbones on the ledge built onto the wall to hold the tea/coffee. In truth, it should have been a double without the added single bed. Protests had us moved to a quad room - no larger really but a spare bed to park the bags. The remaining complaints are all small, but together combine to give an overall feeling of dissatisfaction: Extremely uncomfortable mattress (swapped the next day.) Dirty blankets (replaced the next day.) Only one towel each and no bath mat. Refurbished interior but tacky around the edges. Free internet only accessible in the foyer on your laptop - at painfully slow speeds. (Very expensive broadband available.) Breakfast (included) was toast, 2 juices, 2 cereals, coffee and a cold hard boiled egg. Every morning. The Elysee is in a good location but one gets the impression that it is milking that by cramming as many guests in to it's rooms at as low a cost per head as it can. Certainly, it was full over the weekend. If all you want is a bed, go for it. If you want a comfortable bed and more, look elsewhere...

HotelInfo.Name: Elysee Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25-26 Craven Terrace | Hyde Park, London W2 3EL , England
